title: July 11: Benefit Concert for Vulnerable Families Fund (Durham)
description:
Join members of the Triangle community in a night of community & music about Justice, Peace, and Hope, hosted at Judea Reform Congregation. Presented by Music Director Allan Friedman and the Social Action Committees of Judea Reform Congregation in support of Church World Service (CWS).

7:00-7:30pm: Community & Activism

Learn about:

The nonprofit organization Church World Service and their work helping refugees
Judea Reform’s advocacy and direct service projects to help refugees and immigrants in our community.
The work of Triangle Interfaith Advocates for Refugees and Immigrants is doing to support local and national efforts for justice.
7:30pm-9:00pm: Concert

Choral, vocal, and instrumental music in a variety of styles, featuring music about justice, peace, refuge, and hope performed by musicians from Judea Reform and the wider Triangle Community: singers from Jewish and Christian Congregations, as well as Arabic, African-American, & Latinx musicians.

Free admission, with donations accepted for CWS-Durham and their Vulnerable Families Fund. Please bring cash or check made out to “CWS-Durham” with “vulnerable families fund” in memo. For more information on CWS-Durham visit:https://cwsrdu.org
